abstract: Will the iPhone 3G S solidify Apple as a new contender in the video-gaming industry?
snippet: Will the iPhone 3G S solidify Apple as a new contender in the video-gaming industry?
lead_paragraph: Whether or not the iPhone 3G S, Apple’s latest version of its flagship mobile device, will help the company retain its lead in the smoldering smartphone battle remains to be seen.

abstract: Apple and AT&T are making it clear that the iPhone is less a product than a subscription: Pay $199 every two years, or $399 every year, for a guarantee of newer technology.
snippet: Apple and AT&T are making it clear that the iPhone is less a product than a subscription: Pay $199 every two years, or $399 every year, for a guarantee of newer technology.
lead_paragraph: Debbie Galant, the baroness of Baristanet, the acid-tinged blog for my hometown, Montclair, N.J., sent me a message this morning, asking me to join a Facebook group protesting the pricing for iPhone owners who want to upgrade to the new model. She said, “Spread the word: You’re angry about the roll-out of the new iPhone, which makes current users second-class citizens.”

abstract: I sometimes get garbled messages in my Gmail account. Is there anything I can do to make these readable?
snippet: I sometimes get garbled messages in my Gmail account. Is there anything I can do to make these readable?
lead_paragraph: Q. I sometimes get garbled messages in my Gmail account. Is there anything I can do to make these readable?

abstract: I have an ancient universal remote control but have lost the instructions for programming it to work with my TV and DVD player. Is there a way to find out this information?
snippet: I have an ancient universal remote control but have lost the instructions for programming it to work with my TV and DVD player. Is there a way to find out this information?
lead_paragraph: Q. I have an ancient universal remote control but have lost the codes and instructions for programming it to work with my TV and DVD player. Is there a way to find out this information?

abstract: Take a look at iPhoto’s built-in maintenance tools if you find the program misbehaving.
snippet: Take a look at iPhoto’s built-in maintenance tools if you find the program misbehaving.
lead_paragraph: Apple’s iPhoto software lets you easily organize and edit pictures on your Mac, but the program can sometimes get a little erratic over time, especially with large photo libraries. If you find the program displaying your photo thumbnails as gray rectangles, acting sluggish or generally misbehaving, take a look at iPhoto’s built-in maintenance tools. Using these, you can rebuild the program’s database, thumbnails and file permissions  and also recover unused space from the iPhoto database.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Apple’s iPhoto Software
